column4: hi, im trying to instal a package but it depends on "libwnck18" wich is not available in Gutsy repos, what are my options?
google.
anyone know if theres a tool (pref. with a frontend) for encoding files into wma? Verizon doesn't believe in free formats :/
the problem is that if i find the package in google i get lost in a sea of extra dependecies
cant i do some repo thing using feysty repos
did you try just searching for that library first?
dont worry about the package, find the library
yea
yea you can for sure use a repo to download the app you just gotta find it :p
if you find it on a repo it will have all the libraries and stuff with it
you are using gutsy isnt it?
yeah
havent you tried to install avant dock?
no I think the avant dock is ugly
I want more of a launcher than a nifty task list
do you really think so? (http://tuxlink.wordpress.com/2007/07/13/la-barra-de-leopard-en-ubuntu/)
that Leopard style is looks very pretty
sure but it just doesn't do what i'd want it to do
wich one do you use?
I just use straight gnome. eyecandy got old after a month or two
i could install libwnck18 but now it kep with the same dependency problem, even when im sure the library is installed
what can it be?
